AMhmfnkwiuTW0luemvDxfw.text: Favorite spot in all of Charlotte.  AMAZING selection, always up to date on new releases, and very knowledgeable.  A good amount on draft and priced awesomely.  Feel free to grab a brew on draft or a bottle in the coolers and drink right it right there or take it to go.  Taps rotate so there is always something new and delicious to try.  I'll definitely be back soon!!

kTxs8N7NsxhpHBERsRxsFg.text: Amazing beer selection, cool atmosphere and did I mention beer? Stop in, try something new and take it home with you. What is not to love?

FvCrTEqvX51WSpjNCoDT5Q.text: Enduring the pains of travel delays due to the polar vortex, after an unplanned almost two day layover in Dallas, I finally arrived in Charlotte NC on a late Thursday night. Needless to say I needed a good beer...  Once I woke up I hit up Mert's Heart and Soul in downtown Charlotte for some much needed breakfast and grabbed a Lyft to NoDa. This quaint little once run down area has now been turned into the 'East Village' of Charlotte. Upon searching Yelp! for a beer shop to stock up on NC brews to fly back with me to Southern California, I found Salud Beer Shop. These guys were super helpful and gave some great recommendations on the local brews. Being just blocks from   NoDa Brewing which these guys turned me onto, its a great spot to check out. The best part, other than the fact that they have an amazing craft beer selection, is that they have a few on tap for you to sip on while you browse. If it wasn't for these guys I wouldn't have thought to check out Hop Drop and Roll from NoDa Brewing which is a great West Coast Style IPA that I'm always in favor of. If you find yourself in the Charlotte NC area, be sure to head down to NoDa and check these guys out.

PPoXea4ZSyHn9WGrBev6jw.text: Great selection. Expert knowledge. Love the square wallet checkout. Super fast.

ySIyqKPPZY1Sa5h1d-cLDg.text: If I had to be stranded somewhere with a full wallet and a lot of time, this would be the place. If you can't find a beer perfectly crafted to your taste buds here- go back to Zima.

zCaOZuDb0EIjWxmw04A3BA.text: The best local place to get beer.  It has the feeling of NODA. I have never seen a better selection of cold quality craft beers.

3aUlw9MDZ3RWQxBexw3qyQ.text: This shop is a better place to drink than places that call themselves bars. Jason knows his product, the taps always rock, the beer available for purchase is amazing. Any bad review of this place will answer to me. And I'll have a few empty bottles to be broken over foolish heads thanks to Salud!

mXoMtxEQBA3OW64-4NBh9Q.text: I have only been here a handful of times so far. That being said I have always been recognized by the owner and have always had a great time. They have a ton of beer. That being said. Not a lot of cold ones. Few more coolers and this place is golden. This shop is much needed as well as  the perfect edition to noda. Now if I can only get the owner to give up his source for the Darklord and CBS beers we will have the perfect beer shop. *hint hint* In all seriousness check this place out next time you are in noda. If not for the beer then for the classic Nintendo in the front window. If you can beat my 124,500 points on duck hunt ill buy you a beer!

T6LzJW8R9WvM43uuQd6O0w.text: Best place in Charlotte for beer...draft or bottle...or both!  Jason and Darailyn are great hosts!

m3bnnZGfU6r4RZavZVZd6Q.text: Awesome selection of craft beers by the bottle and 6 pack.I was able to find Polestar Pilsner by Left Hand Brewery here after Growlers Pourhouse ran out of it on tap. Which was actually tragic because that was my boyfriends favorite...lucky for him i was able to surprise him with a 6 pack of his own and a connection to the stuff too. It can be a little overwhelming if you don't know what you're looking for. The walls are lined with shelves, lined with beers, and all the artwork on the bottles sort of blend together to make a giant quilt of mini pictures...its actually pretty cool. The staff is very very helpful, and definitely knows his stuff. I'll definitely make this a regular stop when Im on the hunt for specialty beers.

YxYqfm6l3SD8uXCuO38xLw.text: Great new beer store in NODA! Jason has a really good selection of 6-pk, mixed 6 options as well as 22s.  Picked up a 4-pk of Terrapin's Hopzilla and had to hold back from snagging a number of other gems.  Would highly recommend!

6U9dRWrVNGcNWPXGdwxySA.text: First time there,  heard about on various podcasts. They had a particular kind of cider that  no one else had in area. Very laid back. Great place to have a beer with friends.

yYaJA4t2CDYxglp3nDhRrg.text: Best place for craft beer. Perfect to stop in and grab a 6 pack. Staff knows what's trending and owner is helpful. Love this place.

8np6L-twpYXbs_3mHvCjBw.text: It's a beer store with a decent selection, but also has 4-5 kegs on tap and some small seating areas where you are welcome to pop open a beer you just bought or have one served to you in a plastic glass. The owner is great and can always recommend a great beer. The prices aren't cheap, but they are as good as anywhere else in the area, and for the selection of large beers and growlers, it's actually a pretty good deal.

LFekmrOhn_fEKwEv7zKefg.text: What a great little place.  Selection is great as well.  You will be sure to find the big named craft brews, but you are just as easily going to stumble across a great local selection.  Purchase single bottles/build your own or regular 4-6 packs.  Also a fully stocked fridge for onsite consumption.  I believe there were 6 or 7 taps, all choices formed a solid lineup.  Also will find an entire wall of bombers and thanks to the recently passed law, even saw a sign for growler fills.  Decor was right in line with the rest of the neighborhood with the artsy feel.  Comfy couch near front for seating and a few seats near the back of the store as well.  The guy running the place was really nice, friendly and seemed to do whatever he could to help out or find a selection for each customers enjoyment.  I don't get to this side of town often but look forward to going back. Only downside is their parking lot was recently taken away due to construction.  Good luck with street parking, get there early if you are going on a weekend evening.

l3GQPy6I01coiB-TO768GA.text: Amazing beer selection, availabele to go or to consume immediatly on a little patio. I think I found my new favourite american beer, but it might change next time I'm there.

j17fKnHl6CHcSRejhuB6hw.text: Great beer shop, awesome selection of rare and seasonal beers. Tap rotates regularly, and priced reasonably. Defiantly a place to try something new!

bpL952-cUs6OPHTiUTjw7w.text: I love this place! Salud is everything that is right about the NoDa area. Jason does a great job of keeping a top quality selection of brews at good prices on the shelf. His knowledge of the product is also top notch and it's nice to be able to find some real gems that can't be found around town at his shop. Really been enjoying his tastings from different breweries around the country with the empanadas for a nice little bite to eat while enjoying good company.   With Heist getting ready to open it's doors and with Noda Brewing and Birdsong all just a stones throw away Noda is quickly becoming the place to be for beer lovers in Charlotte. I suggest making a trip up to pick up some great things to bring home and hit a couple local tap rooms in the area. Or just pull up to the bar in Salud and try one of the many beers he has cold or on tap.

fBm8yHBh5jT9ceDAyvoDnw.text: I've been back to Salud several times since my first review.  I still really dig this place and it's established itself well in NoDa.  It can get pretty busy on Friday and Saturday evenings.  There are regular beer tastings during the week, on Wednesdays I think (check their Twitter or FB).  This is a great place to start the evening out if you're into quality beer and I will continue to visit often.

XRz2Umt-fjr-RbAQ6_gu6g.text: Love this shop! The owners are always helpful and they have great craft beer finds. Friendly atmosphere and a fun crowd. If you need a new spot to buy your favorite craft beers this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

FqGVMl-im9oEvp69QM6iwg.text: I love the concept of this place...wall-to-wall beer and a nice little selection of rotating draft beers. Big comfy couches and a little outside area too. (very little-mind you). Beers range in the $5-6 price point. They were nice about sampling / suggesting and it was small but not jammed packed.    The only trouble we had (and reason for - 1 star) was locating someone to serve our beer. The people who work there have the best job ever because they were clearly palling with friends and having a few beers too...which I don't mind but when you have people waiting around for a beer, it makes it awkward for them to interrupt you to ask for a drink . I was also sad to find out the three or four different Nintendo games I tried didn't work...flashback to blowing on the bottom of the games in hopes that Duck Hunt will magically appear.    One suggestion -I wish they offered a discounted draft beer of the day in the $3-4 range.

-um2R10IwGXu3YBZPmE8CA.text: Been coming to Salud for a while and have loved the brew selection, variety and friendliness of the owner each time. Very helpful and always willing to help you find what you're looking for...or what you didn't know you were looking for before your visit.   Multiple times, I've come in and intended on buying a growler or six-pack of a particular brew/brewery and ended up with something else. Love it when that happens.   Love that they carry growlers from "hard to reach" breweries like Greenman, Mystery, and Fullsteam. Though there's nothing like getting it straight from the source, Salud makes it a nice treat when you can't make it to the Triangle, Asheville, or Hillsborough. One other gem that I was stoked to find was Slingshot Coffee. Iced coffee concentrate or ready-to-drink coffee brewed and bottled in Raleigh. I had heard about it in an article and found that Salud is one of the only places that carries it in Charlotte. Looks like I'll be in frequently to pick up this treat.   Love that you can pay with Square, too. Texting myself a receipt is so much better than printing something I'm going to throw away.   Though parking can sometimes be a pain, you can slip in and out really quick if you're picking up beer and going. If you're staying to enjoy beer on draught or take a seat and split a six-pack with some buds, you may want to find a parking space down the road a bit. The parking lot behind the shop seems a little sketchy with all of the $5 signs. I'm never sure what to trust, haha. Proceed with caution.   Cheers!

Kk6tC6iF9wL1iwQw0xDrFQ.text: Came here for some after dinner drinks with a couple of friends and had a great time! It's a quant bottle store with multiple drafts and cold beer options to choose from.  You will find knowledgeable staff who enjoy beer and enjoy sharing their wealth of beer knowledge to help you find the perfect brew.  Salud has comfy couches to chill out and tables where you can play cards or games with your friends.  It's a great place to try a variety of craft beers that you can't easily find elsewhere.  Now anytime we are in the NoDa we will definitely stop by!

jbCDP_uy6qYN9zDnNuSSmg.text: This type of place just doesn't exist where I'm from. But I wish it did. Salud feels like a beer shop -- one with a pretty terrific selection -- that you can actually drink in. This is a concept that was totally foreign to me before moving to Charlotte, but man do I love it.   The owner Jason is about as friendly and affable a guy as you could ask for. Always willing to do what he can to get you what you're looking for in the unlikely event that it's not already on the shelf.   We've only hung out for a drink at Salud once, but we've carried out a ton in the five months or so since we moved to the area. This is hands down the place I prefer to spend my money if I'm looking for some good beer.

o23aE665K7FyO_HkBqk7AQ.text: Salud quickly become one of my favorite watering holes in Charlotte. This place makes you feel right at home the second you walk in. Jason and crew are very accessible, friendly and knowledgeable about the products they put on their shelves, fridges and taps. I've had many a nights here losing myself in great conversations with other beer lovers and other interesting people amidst  great beer, snacks, laughter and cheers.  As if that wasn't enough, Salud offers an incredible beer selection. Probably one of the better selections in town. Also, I love the fact that he always puts interesting beer on his taps. Unlike some other places that boast of taps, yet stock them with the same local beers you can get down the road for cheaper, or, god forbid, AB beers, Jason's selection is usually something you've not tried or is not as readily available.  Walk on in, grab a beer, and strike a conversation with a random stranger. You won't regret spending your evening here.

cYqIJgBUrB2y6Rp55uTaqg.text: When I think of Salud I reflexively start humming the Cheers theme. Jason and his group of some-nights-employees-some-nights-patrons have a great way of making a girl and her beer feel right at home. Add to that an wide selection of shelved and chilled bottles and an impressive tap list and you have the makings of a great bottle shop. There is always something new to try, especially on draft. Charlotte's local breweries are strongly represented but you will also find brews from far and wide, as well as from breweries that have no real home at all (I'm looking at you Evil Twin!).  Sometimes you do want to go where everybody knows your name, and you want to have a great beer when you get there. It is those times for which Salud exists.

FJHauB9YJHB2bNwNJbG-yA.text: loving Salud.  A week in and Jason seems to be doing alright - fully stocked shelves of great choices, a cooler of everything from 12 oz bottles (and cans) to growlers, taps with amazing NC brews, and a nice space to enjoy a few in. The "patio" is a little on the small side (maybe 6 chairs and two tables) but it's cozy, and we were able to hear the live music coming from Wine Up.  With all those options (including some gluten-free), a soon to be growing snack selection (right now it's mostly chips and beef jerky), comfy seating inside, and a very knowledgeable owner - I know I'll be back. Although some of his stock you can get elsewhere in town, it was nice to see some beers and ciders I haven't been able to find in Charlotte.

qDVX6aXI1XMme3FK6jPBbg.text: Broadest beer selection I have found in Charlotte.  Plenty of beer on tap (and in bottles) to try while you are shopping.  The folks who work here are knowledgeable AND nice.  Awesome.

SbAYMwlJG0cHBEHEx74tRQ.text: I ADORE this place.  Went here with some friends who are regulars, so we got to hang out with the owner who was a cool dude.  Got to sample a bunch of different beers, and the owner was very knowledgeable and was able to recommend different types of beer for me to try.  I know some other reviews have mentioned this, so it may be redundant for me to as well, but they have an old school Nintendo NES with not one, but TWO Duck Hunt guns.  So yea.  I will DEFINITELY be going back to this place!

WSOeXB1L6pMITnhxzDu1kQ.text: Best bottle shop in Charlotte.  They run out of stuff fast sometimes so if you are waiting for something in particular don't sleep on it.  They have a dozen taps and most of the beers you won't find anywhere else city.  They should start serving food after the first of the year which will add another dimension to an already great place.

7MaKQDLX1w9AMD9irXRGKA.text: Absolutely great beer selection and such a convenient location.  Only had a chance to stop in for a second today, will thoroughly review ASAP.

61wGDnbagVMsjoiwldQ5Ug.text: The owner  is great. He can suggest a beer for any palate or craving. Awesome selection of stock and a unique draft selection allows you to explore new brews at reasonable prices. Excellent addition to the neighborhood!

a38rFv5SuZaWj_tUnwK8oA.text: Dropped by the Salud Beer Shop on 4/28/12 as part of my first real experience of NoDa.  This is another great spot for beer lovers.  Great selection of beers from around the world with very reasonable prices.  Best part about Salud is that the price for your beer is the same whether you drink it there or pay and take it home with you.  They still keep the prices reasonable with no "corkage fee", but they do have a wide range of prices due the higher end specialty beers that they carry.  Price range is about 2$ to 20$ depending on if you want a PBR can all the way to a 22oz bottle to share with some friends.  My wife, who does not like beery beers as she says, was able to find a wide selection of sours, lambic and geuze beers that she loves.  Everybody was happy, we drank a double IPA by Mikkeller,  St Louis Geuze and Duchesse de Bourgogne.  They do have 4 or 5 taps, but the variety comes in the bottle selection. They have a dozen or so seats, if you want to drink there and I think they have a patio out back as well, but we did not head outside.  We enjoyed a few beers here before we continued our journey through NoDa.

HhWlfy6Dz00-RCKe0_hW3Q.text: My first visit was a quick walk through to check the store out, grab some beer and leave. The store is amazing, from the graffiti outside to all the great beer inside and a freaking NES, what is not to love? I can hardly find Fullsteam Brewery in stores while I am in the Triangle, so imagine my surprise to find it here at Salud. I grabbed a growler and also saw they had growlers from Mystery Brewery in Hillsborough, NC...where I went to high school! The guy running the store said he went and got them himself, props. I am going to get some of that on my next trip.   With a more concentrated selection than Total Wine, awesome store and fair prices; I think I found my new favorite beer store. Next time when I have time I have to play that NES though, for real.

EZTq_Qo-EiXwffG2Ye51qw.text: Excellent beer selection with a small bar in the back for you to sit back and enjoy draft beer. They have a couple of other tables in there as well. If you are looking for a certain beer this is a good place to look.

97Tasl119NxtyESbEj0K3w.text: Guys don't shoot me. Am I the first person not to give Salud five stars? Great comfy leather seating area and flat screens tvs. Ample beer selection but not enough beers in the fridge section cold and ready to drink. I had a delicious pear cider but it would be nice to see more cold brews...

sRtdC2oMTYt9txPIz5Ts2Q.text: Best beer store in Charlotte! Always has some amazing beers on tap. Only place to get good sours.

9q9zSlLNaGtl06_2GWp4Rg.text: Awesome shop and great knowledgable service. Very cool decor/atmosphere and GREAT craft beer selection. Come thirsty!! Grab a game of battleship and hang out on the patio enjoying your beer.

meSvM_1pN5H5MXLR-nV-uA.text: One of the very best bottle shops in North and South Carolina with a wide selection of well crafted beers from all over the globe and an awesome selection of local ones as well. Jason will definitely take care of you here. Must go to place when in the NoDa area.

gW5GErPT3Olc3Fr-qMSZXA.text: This is such a fun little place. For such a small store, they have a very broad beer selection and often have ones that are hard to find elsewhere. You can purchase beer to drink there or take home. In addition to their extensive bottle selection, they also have rotating taps. Salud is also a really great place to hang out. I actually don't think I've ever brought beer hone before because I really enjoy drinking it at the store. They have board games and even an old Nintendo system! Finally, the location of Salud is great. It's in NoDa in close proximity to many other bars in case you want to head elsewhere later in the evening.

FBKYaLNWsg1zh-H-ZWfQaw.text: Awesome. This is my first time coming here and well, lets just say I think this is a very nice alternative to the common market. Except this one has a lot more room and is less crowded. (But, common market has a deli!)  I came here to meet up some friends and we had a very nice time just hanging out. We went from bottle to bottle until the place closed up shop. They have really neat decorations and an awesome selection of beer. We tried mostly NC beers because my friend was from the Bay.   I wouldn't say this place is just a shop, it was definitely a hang out spot as well. Couches, small table, window table, and as well as a bar has a ton of places to just chill.   Overall, if I do have friends over I'll come here to drink and catch up. This is the spot to be!

FfhgYVHFsx7rZ8qibcR79Q.text: If you love craft beer and you haven't been here, it's time for you to check it out.  While it's not the largest shop in the city, it is (in my humble opinion) the best.  And I'll tell ya why.  You'll find all kinds of hard-to-find beers, including seasonal and limited release-type stuff.  You can also find a great variety of local Charlotte beers and NC beers that you cannot find many places outside of the breweries themselves.  There is a bar inside that has a really good draft selection so you can chill and have a beer as you browse.  And perhaps my favorite random thing is that there is a Nintendo set up in the corner so you can play Mario whilest enjoying said beer.  The owner is really friendly and knowledgeable as well, which makes the whole experience even better.  While there is currently no food here, the all new "Fud at Salud" is opening up really soon and will feature some unique sandwiches and other items to help soak up the booze!  From the looks of the work that is going on, it appears that it's close to being ready.    One other thing to note, there is no "parking lot" at Salud.  You have to park on the street either right in front of the place which is hit or miss, or you can head up North Davidson just past the railroad tracks to park on the street there.  That, or you can find another spot around the neighborhood.  It's definitely worth the potential parking hassle!

tNedQswXKWYz8Of2vuMN4g.text: Salud was awesome. I was so unaware you could hangout and drink here I thought it was just a place to buy beer but it's so much more. They have taps and bottles and awesome nachos! I'll definitely be back.

UVrjGrLGWuCLgcrMnTP7uw.text: Fantastic bottle shop. Great atmosphere, knowledgeable staff and owner. Old school Nintendo, a TV for the game, and don't forget to get some food from FuD at Salud (attached and accessible from inside). One of the best places in NoDa.

CORKal8S6KZPaPRCOioJng.text: Checked out Salud on a hump day.... it was sadly, not crowded, which was nice for us... but I would expect this place to be hoppin' after work!  There's a ton of beers to choose from - mix and match to make your own six pack.  Even some beers on draft to try.  We grabbed some Brooklyn Monster and sat on the patio for a little bit on a very nice day.  Totally laid back place to hang out and talk all things beer... or just relax after a long work day.  Made me want to start brewing my own beer right there with all the literature around and all the cool looking micro/craft brews from the area.  I'm sure the owner probably knows a few things about brewing and you can probably get some advice if you are undertaking a new recipe or beer you want to try to make.  The price of beer here was great...  there is a wide range of prices and some really interesting looking beers to try.

AbaWxdO-FsjrmS2_VxCd_g.text: I stopped in the shop after hearing a few people mention it.  This is my third or fourth visit to a bottle shop since my move to Charlotte, and I'd say this is my favorite! The selection of craft beer is fantastic and the prices (considering the quality of the beers they carry) are better than other places I've visited in the area, so far.  The staff seemed willing to help and very knowledgable. They have some beers on tap that you could have there (along with food from the attached FuD) or get a crowler to go. I would absolutely recommend this place to any craft beer nut!

L9r-BgKm-Jz6zNql6mZnFg.text: The best beer shop in Charlotte period! Always has knowledgeable employees willing to find you the perfect beer. Great selection on draft that is always rotating. Music is always on point and the store smells like fresh linen and lavender. Do yourself and your friends a favor and shop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blood Orange Gose, enough said.

VGZYpvRCr40o-XgBqpqwpQ.text: So cool! Best spot to buy boos in South Park. I know nothing about beer and they are always so patient and great with me when I come to buy gifts for my husband. Keep up the good work!

irC6qVF-V__zcugyK0xTwg.text: Cool little beer shop in Noda. It's a solid bottle shop with a wide selection.

ZxDVZZyBCjhQ540HCG8iiA.text: If you don't love Salud, you also probably hate sunshine, puppies, a child's laugh, and America.   There's aways a unique tap selection and plenty of hard to find bottles from which to choose. Salud could get by with great beer alone, but what keeps me coming back are the even greater people responsible for the beer. Jason is a True connoisseur, but he is down-to-earth and incredibly patient with novices - no intimidation or snobbery here. Prices are reasonable, and the beer is fresh (unless it isn't supposed to be) unlike the typical megamart.   tl;dr Go drink here now.

VrXVHKz1LSKvK1vvJ7zH6g.text: As a cider drinker, I wish they had a few more options. It's a small shop with a great variety of beer, though. Gotta love local business, and the word is they're expanding. More room for cider, perhaps? I hope! More seating will make for a longer stay and a more comfortable experience.  I've had great interactions with the staff, but I have a few friends who avoid going in because of poor experiences. Looking forward to visiting post-expansion!

dSSVf6e8Lzng0j1iNgwlNQ.text: They have Nintendo and beer.   That should've been enough, but fine. They have plenty of great bottles of beer, a great welcoming and knowledgeable staff and a nice handful of beers on draft. Charlotte does have several good bottle shops now (none of which are really close to my home), but Salud still just feels the most inviting and is my top choice to go if i plan to hang out for a beer before taking some home.  It would be cool if there were more comfy seats around, but they do quite well with the space they have, including an outdoor space which i'm yet to utilize. They also have a mirror in the bathroom with its own Twitter account (@saludmirror)...so what more do you want? Go and enjoy yourself.

60gH3UbmUWqiY1wiQpM8XQ.text: Decent selection. Seemed cramped and hard to find anything. Only one person working and it was all he could do to keep up with the tap customers. Parking lot next door is a pay lot from 3:00pm - 8:00am.  Also, I asked for Pisgah products, and the young man at the counter said he had never heard of them. You probably should at least know the popular breweries in your state if you are going to dirk in a craft beer store.

yusTuCK2Wuo-z6MwUqvPjA.text: They get fonta flora on tap...rare. i like everything about this place.

ep4U0M3EpzVJEQ-ZtVqwNQ.text: Salud is possibly my favorite beer shop in Charlotte.  Not only is the owner super knowledgeable, their selection is a tough one to defeat.  The prices are solid and their tap selection does not disappoint. They have a very small outside section, but now have a place to get some grub next to it.  Also, they are the only place I know of in Charlotte that sells crowlers.  I effing love crowlers.

CxHGByvruIeJSmWcP3ntgA.text: I rarely ever write reviews or anything of this nature, but my experience today at Salud prompted me to do this. I've been in the bottle shop before, so I knew the incredible selection they have to offer.  Apart from the fact that Salud arguably has the best selection of craft beer in the city of Charlotte, I'm writing this review for a different reason. It is a fairly well known fact that the owner and management of Salud is a huge Michigan wolverine fan.  This is evident by taking a look around the bottle shop and noticing the many pieces of Michigan memorabilia sprinkled in among countless empty bottles of world class beer from the likes of Cantillon, Hill Farmstead, Russian River, Three Floyds, among others. But getting back on point, I'm an avid Ohio State Buckeyes fan, and for those of you who aren't sports savvy, the rivalry between Michigan and Ohio State is one of the oldest and most heated rivalries of any sports team. Today was the day of THE Game, the annual regular season closer between Ohio State and Michigan. I know the owners and staff of salud were well aware of this because they had posted on social media earlier that they would have the game on and be rooting on the Wolverines at the bottle shop. In short, the result was not favorable for wolverines fans. I had already planned on stopping into Salud to check in on the selection before the game was even played, so I did so after the game was finished... And I was still wearing my Ohio State jersey. I was cautious while I started browsing, not wanting to draw attention to myself although I knew the guy behind the bar had seen my jersey. As I picked up a bottle of Prairie Bomb!, he spoke up, "Hey if you're interested, there's still one bottle of Christmas Bomb! left in the cooler!" He then proceeded to walk over to the cooler, grab it, and hand it to me. I was completely taken aback. In the midst of all of the animosity and bad blood that surround this rivalry, he went out of his way to help me get the very last bottle... And I wasn't the only customer in the store, mind you. It was one of the kindest and greatest examples of service and Craft Beermanship that I've ever experienced. First class. Absolutely First Class. Like I said, I rarely ever do this, but the amazing service I received today left me with absolutely no choice. As such, I would recommend Salud to anyone, not merely for the world class selection, but for the world class service.

dBRZr0vlwjcw24FB-VBqCQ.text: Everything about this place is amazing. I love the location, the beer selection and the atmosphere. There are hard to find beers and draught beers. There is a little area to sit outside. Sometimes they have events w/ delicious food. The place has a lot going for it.  My one complaint. I think, perhaps, they should consider a little bit of wine. I'm talking a tiny, itty bitty wine selection. The whole anti-gluten craze has taken over and a handful of my friends refuse to go because it is only beer. Sigh.

75BfP7turnR2-uwONCg4oA.text: Another great addition to the neighborhood!  On a recent search for Hopslam I tweeted to Salud and being that they are tapped into social media avenues solidly I got a prompt response that they indeed had some.  Upon walking in you get the sense this place is very much a laid back local beer shop for NoDa.  Tons of bottles to choose from and few choice brews on tap for the times you have a chance to stay a while.    Super friendly staff and knowledgeable to boot!

lh-kyqictp8jC_d4Yx-Kqg.text: Man I'm glad to have found Salud when I moved to Charlotte.  Moving from Seattle, where beer is as common as the Douglas Firs, it was nice to see a place with the passion I have grown so accustomed to.  They have every beer imaginable especially to be such a small shop.  They also have a small tap list where you can fill a growler or sit down for a drink.  They carry lots of local brews including Fonta Flora (sometimes and only on tap) which is hard to find outside of the brewery.  Drink beer?  Tired of buying it where you buy gas?  Come here.  They will not disappoint.

WObKzz0JnOGY1loASGLsBQ.text: An incredible selection of beers and ciders across the board with a nice rotating tap list for Charlottes thirsty patrons. I like that you are able to purchase a big bottle and share amongst friends therefore getting more to try especially when you are a out of towner who wants to try as many different beers. If your in the area I highly suggest you give this spot a go and plan on at least an hour or two if your thirsty.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dark chocolate sea salt by Ass Clown
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

kWX4TvlWOeeD_dgJ361FZw.text: I have gone to Salud on a few occasions but now that I live in the area, I love it even more. There aren't that many places locally in NoDo where you can stop in get quality craft beers and a great wine selection to go. You can always sit and relax but that is an option you decide. They have fantastic beers on draft too and rotate them often enough you don't ever get bored. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. I wish they had a bigger patio but that is not a complaint!!!! I can't speak for the food YET but I will and update my post.   Make your way down, SALUD!

cVSgxd8GUGdT5MuWoFdBhA.text: It's incredible how many beers they can fit into a small space AND have a bar AND have a food station. Innovative minds for sure. Plus, they have a Primoz Brezec signed basketball behind the bar. Complete #baller status.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Long live the Bobcats and Primoz Brezec!

jAn36SNuOZENM3jLg6oE5Q.text: Such nice people who are very helpful and knowledgeable about craft beers! Also if you haven't tried their chicken and waffle "waffle-wich" you haven't been living your life correctly! Get here asap and try out this awesome place!!

vkbl66Luu3fXh0Q-2uPCjg.text: Salud Beer Shop is pretty dang cool! I've always liked the concept of Taproom and takeout/package shop merged into one. If it's on tap, you can get a growler! Perfect location in NoDa. Small but mighty!  Was looking for one specific beer, UFO Big Squeeze Shandy. They had it! Impressive. I asked for a recommendation on an IPA and I was steered to Westbrook, which ended up being very good!  The bartender was getting ready for a Ballast Point Tap take over and I might have stayed if my car wasn't illegally parked with the blinkers on! He did give me a swig of Sculpin Habanero - oooh feel the burn baby!  Great place for beer lovers and Nerds alike to get some good brews!!

P-pUtAF5BpIoL0R7b4ZA9g.text: Salud may be small, but it's personality is soooo big.  As you enter, you'll pass shelves of unique bottles of beer (and an old-school Nintendo set up on a tube tv....) to get to the small bar in the back.  There's 8 -10 beers on tap - fairly unique finds - with a friendly face behind the bar.  Grab a brew, relax and meet some new folks.

c9IfGpzUdN_7zQimKdi1fw.text: I was sitting in Heist down the street when the bartender informed me that Salud was just down the street and worth a stop in. Being that I was visiting Charlotte only for the weekend I did and boy am I excited I did! Salud not only had the Heist beer I was drinking, but also offered crowler fill ups of it (Heist didn't)!! So I bought 3 of them to go! Salud had an amazing line up on their 12ish drafts, a fantastic bottle selection, and some awesome merchandise. My only complaint was that they didn't have the purple baseball shirt in my size (XL), or I would have bought one! I had to settle for getting a tulip glass instead because their slogan was too awesome not to buy something of! This will always be one of my top stops whenever visiting Charlotte! Thanks again and Salud

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best slogan I&#39;ve seen in a looooooong time! Wish they had the shirt but this will do!

YLqZXYBW3XBsln4VHhgmgQ.text: I have been to Salud Beer Shop a handful of times. I have never been disappointed. The employee and owner are very friendly and helpful. They great selection of beers. I highly recommend this place.

_NZ43GWKRu9QbzX6ZyxSvw.text: Amazing little beer shop with ra really great selection and amazingly friendly staff. We all have been to that one shop that is just a  little too pretentious, well this isn't it! I love the good vibes and the casual feel. This is one of those bars you can pop into with your parents on a chill afternoon or friends on a Friday night. Monday night is draft pint night - all beers under $7 are priced at $3.50. Great deal!

lMFNdIXc4Lc9U-BgMgR3vw.text: great beer selection, owner and employees are very personable and friendly!  Also love fud at salud, kimmy gobbler sandwich is my favorite.   Definitely stop by if you are in CLT and like beer. Not only do they have great beers on tap they will let you open what they sell and drink it there too

wczAE_nvWF1geKUKbb35rg.text: Great little spot in NODA that I've been to a few times and is definitely one of my favorite places out there.  Staff is awesome, beer selection is always good and they also have a really good kitchen where they make some killer sandwiches.  Also have plenty of stuff not on tap available for sale just in case you can't find something you like.    The Jabroni is hands down the best I've had so far but I've heard good things on their other options.  Keep being awesome Salud.

1ukr9U_jQDhIw5VmDEgDSw.text: Was in town for business, staying downtown and ventured to NoDa for dinner. When I travel I like to find local bottle shops to pick up a few to take home to my craft beer loving husband. This was super convenient to a number of well rated restaurants.  The shop was pretty big and has a large variety of bottles both on shelves and in the fridges. You can also try one of their 12 beers on tap or take a crowler of those to go.   I chose a few cans and bottles to travel back to Texas with and the lady behind the counter was super friendly and double wrapped everything for me for easy packing.  Would definitely visit again next time I'm in town -- highly recommend.

_9Ktlkr-maImq0H54_VVTQ.text: The beau and I go here rather often, usually on Monday's for their draft special.  Everyone is always friendly and so knowledgeable. You can definitely tell that the people who work here and own this place truly love beer.

mFaGOKQbkFGnJ9adF_QYGw.text: This place is pretty awesome. I don't drink beer but my fiance' does and he was in heaven! I do like they have other selections for non beer drinkers. Atmosphere is nice and refreshing. There were vintage games for you to play as well as card games. I like that there is bench style tables for you to sit at if you come with a larger group. Staff was friendly and they let my friends try some samples of beer on tap. Large selection of beer on tab and in bottles and cans!

H2234PWq6MTJvnJ9Iiw_Bw.text: Tops of the Hops!  These guys are doing some incredible with beer. They have an amazing variety of different beers available in the 6-pack, 4 pack, or by the bomber. They will even can a beer or fill a growler! They seem to go for the hard-to-find local beers, as well as a lot of seasonal beers.  The selection is pretty amazing. They know their beer, and have hundreds of selections of beers to go for. They have a small bar in here that will serve up a pint, with great daily specials. The service is very friendly.  You can take your food from Fud next door into the bar and check out all the brands they offer.  The shop was clean, and it seemed like the beer inventory rotates around quickly enough that they're not trying to sell previous years' seasonal beers, or had bottles covered in dust. The shop was spotless, and had a few areas to sit and enjoy a beer.   I was happy to see that they offer some free brewing literature near the entrance.  Parking was easy!

pj3ZO_Sdhw8DNy6q3eqq6A.text: Loved the ambience upstairs! Great place to go with a big group or celebrate a special occasion. Definitely going back.

NpgJ4q-W0IKpqh6zMlb0KA.text: A bar and bottle shop basically dedicated to sour beers?! What more could a girl want?! The guy and gal behind the bar were friendly with great recommendations. I will definitely return again.

sPLe5Dg00_fUw4O7ZsuX1A.text: Salud is a great spot to have a pint while shopping for something to take home.  Great selection of local and craft beers.  Great taps.  Out of towners, heads up they can't fill outside growlers (NC Law).  Was able to pick up a couple great NC brews.  Will come back next time I'm in Charlotte/NoDa area.

23Nld9iVu7QYXyiSl16wig.text: Great little bar/bottle shop/food joint! Cozy interior with nice selection at a good price and a super friendly bartender who was nice with he samples and suggestions! The hummus amungus app was just what i needed!

4dnESLOvXrtIWlPzNdm2dQ.text: Always have a great tap list and a huge selection of local stuff in the fridge. Always good vibes and a great place for a drink. With the opening of upstairs couple with the beer shop and fud at Salud it is a dynamic spot, to say the least.

t1h3bX-Qg4mFWB-XjI4YIQ.text: Was not able to experience the Waffle version of Salud, however I was fortunate enough to rip a za here during their soft opening of the pizza oven.  Got the Margherita pizza, and I'll tell you this much it was gone faster than a toupee in a hurricane.  The beer downstairs is also very solid (as I ripped one while I was shoving pizza down my throat). The atmosphere upstairs is a TAD bit different than the atmosphere at the beer shop (which I will also review so don't hold your breath that's coming soon).  Overall REAL solid spot to pick up a pack of brewskis, eat a za, and enjoy a draft beer (if you're into games they have those here as well).   FUNFACT: Salud is spanish for cheers, bless you (when someone sneezes not when the Pope throws some holy water in yo face), and can be used to refer to good health.

YK3_fH-xfzRC_rwidXKcwg.text: Went upstairs to the bar after dinner on a Friday night.  It was somewhat crowded but the bartenders were quick and attentive.  They have some non-alcoholic drinks on tap along with beers.  I had the Mexican Lager and it was pretty standard.   The inside is very clean, open, and modern looking.  I love the wall murals.  There's a side room, too, with a bunch of interesting art work.   Bathroom was clean, but nothing fancy. I'd like to go back to try more and check out what they have for sale downstairs.  Cool place!

ZpD32sKfb4iWL3vphhMzpg.text: This is my favorite place in all of NoDa. Great selection of bottles and the tap is always changing. Everyone is friendly, and the service is always good. I like to come in, have a few beers and jam out to the music playing. Not to mention they rep the D! Feels like I'm in Corktown.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

AAtFSsqO152o3ljGM5IEDA.text: I've been coming here for years. I strayed a little to other places but always found myself back to Salud because they have the best bottle selection in Charlotte AND the best selection of taps. They will have beers on tap that you cannot find anywhere else including beers from the brewery upstairs, special collabs and taps from Fonta Flora that you never see outside of the brewery.  They have a large selection of chilled beers as well so if you can't find anything on tap, you can grab something out of the cooler. Oh yeah, they also sell wine, cider, kombucha and will be serving food again soon.  The staff is great here as well. Very helpful in helping you in finding beer.   My only complaint is they need better air conditioning. It can get quite hot in there. And with a pizza oven coming soon, it will likely get worse.

xV_s7A_w-HHOOS-AxjMa6A.text: Recently voted the best Beer Shop in North America! Great, fun, and casual place with a great upper level that's a bit more fancy with local art, coffee, and great seating for an office away from work!

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Righteous and Barbaric Souls Imperial Stout with Apricot and Vanilla. Burial Beer - Asheville, NC 10%

_SgZV8jiUIoHHizf0Uqqfg.text: Absolutely charming cafe and brewery in the heart of Charlotte's arts district. We loved the ambiance, the friendly staff and clientele, and the delicious beer. It was fun to catch up with old friends over air hockey and drinks. We also loved the cozy but hip decor with a Dia de los Muertos flair. Definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

1yOQ21NjB0VWyHNkss3y8Q.text: This is a great little beer shop on North Davidson. They have beer and bottles of wine in the shop for sale. They have a great selection of beer and wines- definitely the spot to go for a gift. In addition to the bottle shop, there is also a little bar area with taps and a few tables for drinking there. I love that they had Fonta Flora and a few local breweries you don't see on taps too often in CLT. Service is friendly, vibe is chill and trendy, low key and casual. Highly recommend checking Salud out.

sfuhp-LMebNm9a9V-AyVFw.text: One of the best beer shops in the USA with the hardware to prove it. Don't believe me? Read the reviews.. search em online.. or better yet stop in for a beer! Salud knows what they're doing and do it best. The OG bottle shop of Charlotte has all you could need plus more! They are always changing things up. Bringing in new beers. Hosting cool events. And expanding their ideas to the next level.   They now have their own brewery upstairs. Search up Salud Cerveceria. If you're too lazy to head either flight of stairs they usually have one of their beers on tap. They also have wine if beer is not your thing. They have outside seating that is nice and shaded in the afternoon and picnic style seating inside.   You can order from Sabor down the street and get free delivery. Look for the cards on the table. My favorite night is obviously pint night which is every Monday and all beers $7 or under are 3.50. An incredible deal because they get a lot of one off beers and stuff you can't find anywhere else!

lF1hN9VADe11tDrF-2Fdlw.text: I recently tried Salud for the first time. Umm, how have I not been to this place before?! Salud is an adorable beer shop in NoDa with an eclectic and welcome feel, and a bottle selection unlike any other. I went specifically for the Fonta Flora release, and it did not disappoint.   Salud is a place where you can walk in, hang out, order some Sabor delivery (free deliver to Salud!), enjoy a beer, and relax. I highly recommend it.  Street parking in available but is limited.

frrc2Me4nCRbygBTZbV9-g.text: I don't know how I have lived in Charlotte for so long and have never been to Salud.  Is this heaven? No, it's Salud.  The staff is great, the vintage Hornets stuff all over the place is awesome. So many good things. They offer a lot of different beers on tap from all over the place and the walls are lined with 4-packs and coolers for some "road sodas" if you would fancy one. We hung out downstairs, but I understand that there is an upstairs. I guess I will have to go back to explore that. Shucks.  I believe I saw a food menu somewhere but I could be wrong. I do know that Sabor delivers for free if you order online. I may bring a blow-up mattress next time and never leave.

LB9B8jM-JkBfV-xraEcs3w.text: Saluuuuuuud!  The local bottle shop that has made themselves in to so much more.  They now offer their own brewery upstairs called the salud cerveceria.  Downstairs they are still rocking a top level tap selection matched with a solid selection in the refrigerator case.  You may come across Maine brewing, Grimm out of Brooklyn or something you have never even heard of that you love.  They also support all the locals with plenty of noda, birdsong and triple C on their shelves.  This is a great spot to grab some of asheville's best as well, they are always stocked well with Burial.  Their owners seem like really nice people and you may even run in to them in the bottle shop or upstairs in the new spot.  I love this place for being one of the most chill spots in Charlotte.  Bottle shops galore in this town yet i still keep coming back to my old standby, Salud.  Top notch, see for your self.

wg_25NrNvvliLt-Ctjt7iw.text: I really love the atmosphere in the upstairs of Salud. This place has only been open for a handful of months but they have made their presence known and refined their brand. It doubles as great place to get work done or wind down with friends, seeing as you can choose from coffee OR beer. For my fellow vegans/vegetarians, there's enough for us to enjoy on the menu, both drink- and food-wise. And you can order food from downstairs, too!  There are a handful of large tables that could probably seat eight in total if we're getting comfy. There's a tabletop shuffleboard game which is fun. There are seats at the bar as well as a second countertop. There is also a comfy seating area. There is ample standing room as well which comes in handy when they have live music shows on their little stage. This place is truly so multi-faceted, it can really serve whatever purpose you need it to. Recommend checking it out either on a Saturday night or Sunday morning!

0PhAhaPZ2QdxY_Yk9YOTFA.text: These guys are awesome helping with beer selection They know their beers . Upstairs coffee house was wonderful

eSTjZHnjM2VqARkfRtNeLw.text: A very cool spot to hang out or buy beer.  I have been coming here for awhile and love Jason and his wife.   Always great customers service, even more so when they are around.  Jason will take time to talk to you, no matter how busy he is.  The shop is small, but well stocked with many beers and wines.  It is very neat, clean, and organized.  I love the idea and how wonderfully it all fits together.  They always have a pretty good selection of beers on tap as well.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking to buy craft beer.  Sit inside or out on the back patio and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

suYt08t4gJlTFwo0oHUi-w.text: This place is great!  They have a wonderful selection of tap beers and a huge selection of craft beers for sale.  They also make great pizza!  I'm from NY and find solace in their pizza that is the best I have found in Charlotte to date.

NgeGsVlM2FVIGLsCsV-PUA.text: Concert time. And, of course, any wise concert goer will ensure to partake in good eats and delicious craft beer. We saw this place before, but Noda has so many great places. So this time I recalled this tasting room. Walked in and I was overwhelmed with a wave of tasty beer. WOW! Very impressive.  We sat at the bar,  and let me tell you, when I looked up at their menu I saw THREE beers on tap that were 12 ABV and above: Yes you read right. ON TAP!    We have been to 20 breweries and our fair share of bars and I was delighted to see different beers. We tried the Old Fashion and triple IPA. Even though it was 88 IBU, the IPA was a little on the sweet side with no extreme bite.   Jason was personable and engaged us often even though it was busy. He was even able to suggest a beer from the fridge. It was fantastic. This place is literally beer heaven.  This would be great if Hawaii had anything close to this, I may have never left... hahaha just kidding. They had more beer choices in this tiny estabishment than all the beer joints in the 808 state! All the conversations throughout the joint were about beer. Ok, this place is a must visit.  Each time we come to Noda it will be stop #1. Also, don't forget  to get a Crowler or 4 pack to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out what&#39;s on tap
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Serious selection

KaK0RDB4Ku8cepy-9d-cQg.text: Wonderful beer and good times! This spot was a good way to top off my visit to Charlotte.  I will be back here each time that I visit Charlotte! Thanks again for the great service and funky good times!

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

qnDPdNmktVEeGpPM_tvYOA.text: Yes! So much yes! One of the best beer selections in Charlotte both on draft and in bottles/cans. I've discovered some of my favorite beers here, Burial's Bolo and Lenny Boy's Magellan included!   They can get crowded but service is always quick. Grab a spot at the bar or one of the tables and get ready for a fun, laid-back night. Fud at Salud is also a perfect compliment to all the wonderful beer. I'm excited to watch them expand upstairs. More room for good food and beer is always a great thing!

9mtIslA8Xlwl8ONbdtZMeQ.text: I have passed by this place many times. I think I've been in once trying to track down a beer I had in NJ. So this time I end up in there looking for yeast to make ginger beer. Don't ask it what my phone pulled up. Anyway after walking in and realizing instantly that no yeast will be found there. I sat at the bar and grabbed a beer. I'm happy siri gave me wrong info. I had a good time chilling there. The owner was working and very friendly. I learned they had a brewery above them. I also got put on to a new radio show on beats 1 radio. So Good Beer check, Good Music, check, Cool people check. Coming Back double check.

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

PERzCGFkFPqvPUa1oEpbPQ.text: Fantastic selection of beer in this little bottle shop. Dairelyn is the shit!  She answered all of our questions and had some great insight into East Coast brews.  She even took time to carefully wrap our bottles for the plane ride home.  While we were there we met the owner of another bar - you know the place has to be good if people would rather drink there than their own bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Salud Beer Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great tap selection!
